sen.j: 西光（さいこう、生年不詳 - 安元3年6月3日 (旧暦)（1177年6月30日））は平安時代後期の僧・後白河院の近臣。
sen.e: Saiko (??? - June 30, 1177) was a monk and a Goshirakawa-in's trusted vassal who lived in the late Heian era.

sen.j: 俗名は藤原 師光（ふじわら の もろみつ）。
sen.e: His secular name was FUJIWARA no Moromitsu.

sen.j: 阿波国の豪族麻植為光の子で、藤原家成の養子。
sen.e: He was a son of Tamemitsu OE, who was a member of the ruling family in Awa Province, and was later adopted by FUJIWARA no Ienari.

sen.j: 信西（信西）乳母の子と言われる。
sen.e: Some say that he was a child of Shinzei's menoto (a woman providing breast-feeding to a highborn baby).

sen.j: 麻植大宮司家（麻植郡忌部神社祠官）の麻植為光の子で、もとは阿波国の在庁官人であったが、藤原家成の養子、乳兄弟とされる信西の家来となり、左衛門尉に昇る。
sen.e: He was a son of Tamemitsu OE of the Oe Daiguji (Shinto priest of Inbe-jinja Shrine in Oe County) family and was originally a Zaichokanjin (local official in the Heian and Kamakura periods) of Awa Province; however, he then was adopted by FUJIWARA no Ienari, became a retainer of Shinzei who was supposedly his foster brother, and was promoted up to Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 平治の乱で信西が死ぬと出家して西光と名乗る。
sen.e: After the death of Shinzei in the Heiji Disturbance, he entered the priesthood and started to call himself Saiko.

sen.j: のち後白河天皇に仕え、第一の近臣と呼ばれた。
sen.e: He later served Goshirakawa-in and was called the most trusted vassal.

sen.j: 西光は藤原成親・俊寛・多田行綱らの平氏打倒の陰謀に加わり、鹿ヶ谷の山荘での密議の首謀者となる（鹿ケ谷の陰謀）。
sen.e: Saiko joined a conspiracy by FUJIWARA no Narichika, Shunkan, and Yukitsuna TADA to beat the Taira clan, and became the mastermind of the closed discussion at the lodge in Shishigatani (the Shishigatani plot).

sen.j: 子の藤原師高と藤原師経が延暦寺と紛争を起こし、比叡山大衆が強訴する騒ぎとなる。
sen.e: His children, FUJIWARA no Morotaka and FUJIWARA no Morotsune, caused a conflict with the members of Enryaku-ji Temple and this developed into a large social event in which monks of Hiei-zan Mountain made a petition.

sen.j: 師高と師経は処罰されるが、西光が後白河法皇に讒訴して天台座主明雲の天台座主職を停止させ、拷問の上で伊豆国に流罪にさせた。
sen.e: Morotaka and Morotsune were punished, and Saiko then falsely charged Myoun of Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) so that Goshirakawa-in removed him from the Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) position, tortured him, and deported him to Izu Province.

sen.j: 明雲は配流の途中で衆徒に奪回され、西光は後白河法皇に厳罰を進言する。
sen.e: Myoun however was rescued by monk-soldiers in the middle of his deportation, and Saiko then recommended Goshirakawa-in punish Myoun harshly.

sen.j: 1177年、比叡山との紛争の最中に多田行綱が鹿ヶ谷の陰謀を平清盛に密告。
sen.e: In 1177, Yukitsuna TADA told TAIRA no Kiyomori about the Shishigatani plot during the conflict with the Hiei-zan Mountain monks.

sen.e: Saiko sought refuge with Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa but was captured.

sen.j: 清盛は西光の顔を踏みつけ責めるが、西光は逆に平氏を罵った。
sen.e: Kiyomori stomped on Saiko's face and condemned him, but Saiko cursed the Taira clan.

sen.e: Kiyomori got angry and tortured Saiko, and finally had him beheaded at Gojo Nishi Suzaku.
